description: An ospfv3VirtIfStateChange notification signifies that there
has been a change in the state of an OSPFv3 virtual
interface.
This notification should be generated when the interface
state regresses (e.g., goes from Point-to-Point to Down)
or progresses to a terminal state (i.e., Point-to-Point).
A 32-bit integer uniquely identifying the
router in the Autonomous System. To ensure
uniqueness, this may default to the value of
one of the router's IPv4 host addresses,
represented as a 32-bit unsigned integer,
if IPv4 is configured on the router.
variables.name: OSPFV3-MIB-JUNIPER::jnxOspfv3RouterId

description: ospf virtual interface states. The same encoding
as the ospfV3IfTable is used.
variables.name: OSPFV3-MIB-JUNIPER::jnxOspfv3VirtIfState

description: An ospfv3NbrStateChange notification signifies that
there has been a change in the state of a
non-virtual OSPFv3 neighbor. This notification should be
generated when the neighbor state regresses
(e.g., goes from Attempt or Full to 1-Way or
Down) or progresses to a terminal state (e.g.,
2-Way or Full). When an neighbor transitions
from or to Full on non-broadcast multi-access
and broadcast networks, the notification should be
generated by the designated router. A designated
router transitioning to Down will be noted by
ospfIfStateChange.

event.Summary: State of non-virtual OSPFv3 neighbor is $v2

description: A 32-bit integer uniquely identifying the
router in the Autonomous System. To ensure
uniqueness, this may default to the value of
one of the router's IPv4 host addresses,
represented as a 32-bit unsigned integer,
if IPv4 is configured on the router.
variables.name: OSPFV3-MIB-JUNIPER::jnxOspfv3RouterId

description: The State of the relationship with this
Neighbor.
variables.name: OSPFV3-MIB-JUNIPER::jnxOspfv3NbrState

description: An ospfv3VirtNbrStateChange notification signifies
that there has been a change in the state of an OSPFv3
virtual neighbor. This notification should be generated
when the neighbor state regresses (e.g., goes
from Attempt or Full to 1-Way or Down) or
progresses to a terminal state (e.g., Full).

event.Summary: State of an OSPFv3 virtual neighbor is $v2

description: A 32-bit integer uniquely identifying the
router in the Autonomous System. To ensure
uniqueness, this may default to the value of
one of the router's IPv4 host addresses,
represented as a 32-bit unsigned integer,
if IPv4 is configured on the router.
variables.name: OSPFV3-MIB-JUNIPER::jnxOspfv3RouterId

description: The state of the Virtual Neighbor Relationship.
variables.name: OSPFV3-MIB-JUNIPER::jnxOspfv3VirtNbrState

description: An ospfv3IfConfigError notification signifies that a
packet has been received on a non-virtual
interface from a router whose configuration
parameters conflict with this router's
configuration parameters. Note that the event
optionMismatch should cause a notification only if it
prevents an adjacency from forming.

event.Summary: Conflict ($v4) identified in configuration parameters of a non-virtual interface

objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD OSPFV3-MIB-JUNIPER::jnxOspfv3IfConfigError OSPFV3-MIB-JUNIPER::jnxOspfv3RouterId u 1 OSPFV3-MIB-JUNIPER::jnxOspfv3IfState i 1 OSPFV3-MIB-JUNIPER::jnxOspfv3PacketSrc s EXAMPLE OSPFV3-MIB-JUNIPER::jnxOspfv3ConfigErrorType i 1 OSPFV3-MIB-JUNIPER::jnxOspfv3PacketType i 1

description: A 32-bit integer uniquely identifying the
router in the Autonomous System. To ensure
uniqueness, this may default to the value of
one of the router's IPv4 host addresses,
represented as a 32-bit unsigned integer,
if IPv4 is configured on the router.
variables.name: OSPFV3-MIB-JUNIPER::jnxOspfv3RouterId

description: The OSPFv3 Interface State.
variables.name: OSPFV3-MIB-JUNIPER::jnxOspfv3IfState

description: The IPv6 address of an inbound packet that cannot
be identified by a neighbor instance. When
the last value of a notification using this object is
needed, but no notifications of that type have been sent,
the value pertaining to this object should
be returned as 0
Only IPv6 addresses without zone index are expected.
variables.name: OSPFV3-MIB-JUNIPER::jnxOspfv3PacketSrc

description: Potential types of configuration conflicts.
Used by the ospfv3ConfigError and
ospfv3ConfigVirtError notifications. When the last value
of a notification using this object is needed, but no
notifications of that type have been sent, this value
pertaining to this object should be returned as
noError
variables.name: OSPFV3-MIB-JUNIPER::jnxOspfv3ConfigErrorType

description: OSPFv3 packet types. When the last value of a notification
using this object is needed, but no notifications of
that type have been sent, the value pertaining
to this object should be returned as nullPacket
variables.name: OSPFV3-MIB-JUNIPER::jnxOspfv3PacketType

description: An ospfv3VirtIfConfigError notification signifies that a
packet has been received on a virtual interface
from a router whose configuration parameters
conflict with this router's configuration
parameters. Note that the event optionMismatch
should cause a notification only if it prevents an
adjacency from forming.

event.Summary: Conflict ($v3) identified in configuration parameters on virtual interface

objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD OSPFV3-MIB-JUNIPER::jnxOspfv3VirtIfConfigError OSPFV3-MIB-JUNIPER::jnxOspfv3RouterId u 1 OSPFV3-MIB-JUNIPER::jnxOspfv3VirtIfState i 1 OSPFV3-MIB-JUNIPER::jnxOspfv3ConfigErrorType i 1 OSPFV3-MIB-JUNIPER::jnxOspfv3PacketType i 1

description: A 32-bit integer uniquely identifying the
router in the Autonomous System. To ensure
uniqueness, this may default to the value of
one of the router's IPv4 host addresses,
represented as a 32-bit unsigned integer,
if IPv4 is configured on the router.
variables.name: OSPFV3-MIB-JUNIPER::jnxOspfv3RouterId

description: ospf virtual interface states. The same encoding
as the ospfV3IfTable is used.
variables.name: OSPFV3-MIB-JUNIPER::jnxOspfv3VirtIfState

description: Potential types of configuration conflicts.
Used by the ospfv3ConfigError and
ospfv3ConfigVirtError notifications. When the last value
of a notification using this object is needed, but no
notifications of that type have been sent, this value
pertaining to this object should be returned as
noError
variables.name: OSPFV3-MIB-JUNIPER::jnxOspfv3ConfigErrorType

description: OSPFv3 packet types. When the last value of a notification
using this object is needed, but no notifications of
that type have been sent, the value pertaining
to this object should be returned as nullPacket
variables.name: OSPFV3-MIB-JUNIPER::jnxOspfv3PacketType

description: An ospfv3IfRxBadPacket notification signifies that an
ospfv3 packet that cannot be parsed has been received on a
non-virtual interface.

event.Summary: Non-virtual interface received OSPFv3 $v4 packet that cannot be parsed

objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD OSPFV3-MIB-JUNIPER::jnxOspfv3IfRxBadPacket OSPFV3-MIB-JUNIPER::jnxOspfv3RouterId u 1 OSPFV3-MIB-JUNIPER::jnxOspfv3IfState i 1 OSPFV3-MIB-JUNIPER::jnxOspfv3PacketSrc s EXAMPLE OSPFV3-MIB-JUNIPER::jnxOspfv3PacketType i 1

description: A 32-bit integer uniquely identifying the
router in the Autonomous System. To ensure
uniqueness, this may default to the value of
one of the router's IPv4 host addresses,
represented as a 32-bit unsigned integer,
if IPv4 is configured on the router.
variables.name: OSPFV3-MIB-JUNIPER::jnxOspfv3RouterId

description: The OSPFv3 Interface State.
variables.name: OSPFV3-MIB-JUNIPER::jnxOspfv3IfState

description: The IPv6 address of an inbound packet that cannot
be identified by a neighbor instance. When
the last value of a notification using this object is
needed, but no notifications of that type have been sent,
the value pertaining to this object should
be returned as 0
Only IPv6 addresses without zone index are expected.
variables.name: OSPFV3-MIB-JUNIPER::jnxOspfv3PacketSrc

description: OSPFv3 packet types. When the last value of a notification
using this object is needed, but no notifications of
that type have been sent, the value pertaining
to this object should be returned as nullPacket
variables.name: OSPFV3-MIB-JUNIPER::jnxOspfv3PacketType

description: An ospfv3VirtIfRxBadPacket notification signifies
that an OSPFv3 packet that cannot be parsed has been received
on a virtual interface.

event.Summary: Virtal interface received OSPFv3 $v3 packet that cannot be parsed

objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD OSPFV3-MIB-JUNIPER::jnxOspfv3VirtIfRxBadPacket OSPFV3-MIB-JUNIPER::jnxOspfv3RouterId u 1 OSPFV3-MIB-JUNIPER::jnxOspfv3VirtIfState i 1 OSPFV3-MIB-JUNIPER::jnxOspfv3PacketType i 1

description: A 32-bit integer uniquely identifying the
router in the Autonomous System. To ensure
uniqueness, this may default to the value of
one of the router's IPv4 host addresses,
represented as a 32-bit unsigned integer,
if IPv4 is configured on the router.
variables.name: OSPFV3-MIB-JUNIPER::jnxOspfv3RouterId

description: ospf virtual interface states. The same encoding
as the ospfV3IfTable is used.
variables.name: OSPFV3-MIB-JUNIPER::jnxOspfv3VirtIfState

description: OSPFv3 packet types. When the last value of a notification
using this object is needed, but no notifications of
that type have been sent, the value pertaining
to this object should be returned as nullPacket
variables.name: OSPFV3-MIB-JUNIPER::jnxOspfv3PacketType

description: An ospfv3LsdbOverflow notification signifies that the
number of LSAs in the router's link-state
database has exceeded ospfv3ExtAreaLsdbLimit.

event.Summary: Number of LSAs in router's link state database exceeded the limit $v2

description: A 32-bit integer uniquely identifying the
router in the Autonomous System. To ensure
uniqueness, this may default to the value of
one of the router's IPv4 host addresses,
represented as a 32-bit unsigned integer,
if IPv4 is configured on the router.
variables.name: OSPFV3-MIB-JUNIPER::jnxOspfv3RouterId

description: The maximum number of non-default
AS-external-LSAs entries that can be stored in the
link state database. If the value is -1, then
there is no limit.
When the number of non-default AS-external-LSAs
in a router's link-state database reaches
ospfv3ExtAreaLsdbLimit, the router enters Overflow
state. The router never holds more than
ospfv3ExtAreaLsdbLimit non-default AS-external-LSAs
in its database. Ospfv3ExtAreaLsdbLimit MUST be set
identically in all routers attached to the OSPFv3
backbone and/or any regular OSPFv3 area. (i.e.,
OSPFv3 stub areas and NSSAs are excluded).
variables.name: OSPFV3-MIB-JUNIPER::jnxOspfv3ExtAreaLsdbLimit

description: An ospfv3LsdbApproachingOverflow notification signifies
that the number of LSAs in the router's
link-state database has exceeded ninety percent of
ospfv3ExtAreaLsdbLimit.

event.Summary: Number of LSAs in router's link state database has exceeded 90% of the limit $v2

description: A 32-bit integer uniquely identifying the
router in the Autonomous System. To ensure
uniqueness, this may default to the value of
one of the router's IPv4 host addresses,
represented as a 32-bit unsigned integer,
if IPv4 is configured on the router.
variables.name: OSPFV3-MIB-JUNIPER::jnxOspfv3RouterId

description: The maximum number of non-default
AS-external-LSAs entries that can be stored in the
link state database. If the value is -1, then
there is no limit.
When the number of non-default AS-external-LSAs
in a router's link-state database reaches
ospfv3ExtAreaLsdbLimit, the router enters Overflow
state. The router never holds more than
ospfv3ExtAreaLsdbLimit non-default AS-external-LSAs
in its database. Ospfv3ExtAreaLsdbLimit MUST be set
identically in all routers attached to the OSPFv3
backbone and/or any regular OSPFv3 area. (i.e.,
OSPFv3 stub areas and NSSAs are excluded).
variables.name: OSPFV3-MIB-JUNIPER::jnxOspfv3ExtAreaLsdbLimit

description: An ospfv3IfStateChange notification signifies that there
has been a change in the state of a non-virtual
OSPFv3 interface. This notification should be generated
when the interface state regresses (e.g., goes
from Dr to Down) or progresses to a terminal
state (i.e., Point-to-Point, DR Other, Dr, or
Backup).
A 32-bit integer uniquely identifying the
router in the Autonomous System. To ensure
uniqueness, this may default to the value of
one of the router's IPv4 host addresses,
represented as a 32-bit unsigned integer,
if IPv4 is configured on the router.
variables.name: OSPFV3-MIB-JUNIPER::jnxOspfv3RouterId

description: The OSPFv3 Interface State.
variables.name: OSPFV3-MIB-JUNIPER::jnxOspfv3IfState

description: An ospfv3NssaTranslatorStatusChange notification
indicates that there has been a change in the router's
ability to translate OSPFv3 NSSA LSAs into OSPFv3 External
LSAs. This notification should be generated when the
Translator Status transitions from or to any defined
status on a per area basis.
A 32-bit integer uniquely identifying the
router in the Autonomous System. To ensure
uniqueness, this may default to the value of
one of the router's IPv4 host addresses,
represented as a 32-bit unsigned integer,
if IPv4 is configured on the router.
variables.name: OSPFV3-MIB-JUNIPER::jnxOspfv3RouterId

description: Indicates if and how an NSSA Border router is
performing NSSA translation of NSSA-LSAs into
AS-External-LSA's. When this object is set to enabled,
the NSSA Border router's ospfv3AreaNssTranslatorRole
has been set to always. When this object is set to
elected, a candidate NSSA Border router is translating
NSSA-LSA's into AS-External-LSA's. When this object is
set to disabled, a candidate NSSA Border router is NOT
translating NSSA-LSA's into AS-External-LSA's.
variables.name: OSPFV3-MIB-JUNIPER::jnxOspfv3AreaNssaTranslatorState

description: An ospfv3RestartStatusChange notification signifies that
there has been a change in the graceful restart
state for the router. This notification should be
generated when the router restart status
changes.

event.Summary: Graceful restart state for router changed to $v2. Restart status: $v4

description: A 32-bit integer uniquely identifying the
router in the Autonomous System. To ensure
uniqueness, this may default to the value of
one of the router's IPv4 host addresses,
represented as a 32-bit unsigned integer,
if IPv4 is configured on the router.
variables.name: OSPFV3-MIB-JUNIPER::jnxOspfv3RouterId

description: The current status of OSPF Graceful restart capability.
variables.name: OSPFV3-MIB-JUNIPER::jnxOspfv3RestartStatus

description: Configured OSPF Graceful restart timeout interval.
variables.name: OSPFV3-MIB-JUNIPER::jnxOspfv3RestartInterval

description: Describes the outcome of the last attempt at a
Graceful restart.
none:............no restart has yet been attempted.
inProgress:......a restart attempt is currently underway.
completed:.......the last restart completed successfully.
timedOut:........the last restart timed out.
topologyChanged:.the last restart was aborted due to
a topology change.
variables.name: OSPFV3-MIB-JUNIPER::jnxOspfv3RestartExitRc

description: An ospfv3NbrRestartHelperStatusChange notification
signifies that there has been a change in the
graceful restart helper state for the neighbor.
This notification should be generated when the
neighbor restart helper status transitions for a neighbor.

event.Summary: Graceful restart helper state for neighbor changed to $v2. Restart status: $v4

description: A 32-bit integer uniquely identifying the
router in the Autonomous System. To ensure
uniqueness, this may default to the value of
one of the router's IPv4 host addresses,
represented as a 32-bit unsigned integer,
if IPv4 is configured on the router.
variables.name: OSPFV3-MIB-JUNIPER::jnxOspfv3RouterId

description: Indicates whether the router is acting
as a Graceful restart helper for the neighbor.
variables.name: OSPFV3-MIB-JUNIPER::jnxOspfv3NbrRestartHelperStatus

description: Remaining time in current OSPF Graceful restart
interval, if the router is acting as a restart
helper for the neighbor.
variables.name: OSPFV3-MIB-JUNIPER::jnxOspfv3NbrRestartHelperAge

description: Describes the outcome of the last attempt at acting
as a Graceful restart helper for the neighbor.
none:............no restart has yet been attempted.
inProgress:......a restart attempt is currentlyly underway.
completed:.......the last restart completed successfully.
timedOut:........the last restart timed out.
topologyChanged:.the last restart was aborted due to
a topology change.
variables.name: OSPFV3-MIB-JUNIPER::jnxOspfv3NbrRestartHelperExitRc

description: An ospfv3VirtNbrRestartHelperStatusChange
notification signifies that there has been a
change in the graceful restart helper state for
the virtual neighbor. This notification should be
generated when the virtual neighbor restart helper status
transitions for a virtual neighbor.

event.Summary: Graceful restart helper state for virtual neighbor changed to $v2. Restart status: $v4

description: A 32-bit integer uniquely identifying the
router in the Autonomous System. To ensure
uniqueness, this may default to the value of
one of the router's IPv4 host addresses,
represented as a 32-bit unsigned integer,
if IPv4 is configured on the router.
variables.name: OSPFV3-MIB-JUNIPER::jnxOspfv3RouterId

description: Indicates whether the router is acting
as a Graceful restart helper for the neighbor.
variables.name: OSPFV3-MIB-JUNIPER::jnxOspfv3VirtNbrRestartHelperStatus

description: Remaining time in current OSPF Graceful restart
interval, if the router is acting as a restart
helper for the neighbor.
variables.name: OSPFV3-MIB-JUNIPER::jnxOspfv3VirtNbrRestartHelperAge

description: Describes the outcome of the last attempt at acting
as a Graceful restart helper for the neighbor.
none:............no restart has yet been attempted.
inProgress:......a restart attempt is currently underway.
completed:.......the last restart completed successfully.
timedOut:........the last restart timed out.
topologyChanged:.the last restart was aborted due to
a topology change.
variables.name: OSPFV3-MIB-JUNIPER::jnxOspfv3VirtNbrRestartHelperExitRc
